admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund:
TF026473-PHRD-DJIBOUTI: HEALTH SYSTEM
            AND SUPPORT PROJECT,TF056318-DJIBOUTI:BALBALA HOSPITAL MODERNIZATION,TF096100-Djibouti Nutrition

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Health Sector
            Development Project for Djibouti were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: when the health sector is being financed
            by Government and by several donors, it is important to
            ensure that these different interventions complement each
            other, without duplication of efforts. Health services
            cannot have a favorable and sustainable impact on the
            population if there are no drugs and if the medical
            personnel are not qualified and motivated to perform their
            services. A functional Health Management Information System
            (HMIS) is important for a project that aims to reduce
            maternal and child mortality. The establishment and
            operation of a drug fund must be carefully prepared with an
            implementation manual covering all aspects, from the list of
            essential generic drugs, the procurement strategy, and the
            system for drug deliveries and for managing inventories, to
            the keeping of accounts and financial management including
            mechanisms to ensure financial viability.
